00007 Rboolean isValid_Csparse(SEXP x)
00008 {
00009     /* NB: we do *NOT* check a potential 'x' slot here, at all */
00010     SEXP pslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym),
00011         islot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_iSym);
00012     int *dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym)), j,
00013         nrow = dims[0],
00014         ncol = dims[1],
00015         *xp = INTEGER(pslot),
00016         *xi = INTEGER(islot);
00017 
00018     if (length(pslot) != dims[1] + 1)
00019         return FALSE;
00020     if (xp[0] != 0)
00021         return FALSE;
00022     if (length(islot) < xp[ncol]) /* allow larger slots from over-allocation!*/
00023         return FALSE;
00024     for (j = 0; j < xp[ncol]; j++) {
00025         if (xi[j] < 0 || xi[j] >= nrow)
00026             return FALSE;
00027     }
00028     for (j = 0; j < ncol; j++) {
00029         if (xp[j] > xp[j + 1])
00030             return FALSE;
00031     }
00032     return TRUE;
00033 }

00035 SEXP Csparse_validate(SEXP x) {
00036     return Csparse_validate_(x, FALSE);
00037 }
00038 
00039 SEXP Csparse_validate2(SEXP x, SEXP maybe_modify) {
00040     return Csparse_validate_(x, asLogical(maybe_modify));
00041 }
00042 
00043 SEXP Csparse_validate_(SEXP x, Rboolean maybe_modify)
00044 {
00045     /* NB: we do *NOT* check a potential 'x' slot here, at all */
00046     SEXP pslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym),
00047         islot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_iSym);
00048     Rboolean sorted, strictly;
00049     int j, k,
00050         *dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym)),
00051         nrow = dims[0],
00052         ncol = dims[1],
00053         *xp = INTEGER(pslot),
00054         *xi = INTEGER(islot);
00055 
00056     if (length(pslot) != dims[1] + 1)
00057         return mkString(_("slot p must have length = ncol(.) + 1"));
00058     if (xp[0] != 0)
00059         return mkString(_("first element of slot p must be zero"));
00060     if (length(islot) < xp[ncol]) /* allow larger slots from over-allocation!*/
00061         return
00062             mkString(_("last element of slot p must match length of slots i and x"));
00063     for (j = 0; j < xp[ncol]; j++) {
00064         if (xi[j] < 0 || xi[j] >= nrow)
00065             return mkString(_("all row indices must be between 0 and nrow-1"));
00066     }
00067     sorted = TRUE; strictly = TRUE;
00068     for (j = 0; j < ncol; j++) {
00069         if (xp[j] > xp[j + 1])
00070             return mkString(_("slot p must be non-decreasing"));
00071         if(sorted) /* only act if >= 2 entries in column j : */
00072             for (k = xp[j] + 1; k < xp[j + 1]; k++) {
00073                 if (xi[k] < xi[k - 1])
00074                     sorted = FALSE;
00075                 else if (xi[k] == xi[k - 1])
00076                     strictly = FALSE;
00077             }
00078     }
00079     if (!sorted) {
00080         if(maybe_modify) {
00081             CHM_SP chx = (CHM_SP) alloca(sizeof(cholmod_sparse));
00082             R_CheckStack();
00083             as_cholmod_sparse(chx, x, FALSE, TRUE);/*-> cholmod_l_sort() ! */
00084             /* as chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x)  but  ^^^^ sorting x in_place !!! */
00085 
00086             /* Now re-check that row indices are *strictly* increasing
00087              * (and not just increasing) within each column : */
00088             for (j = 0; j < ncol; j++) {
00089                 for (k = xp[j] + 1; k < xp[j + 1]; k++)
00090                     if (xi[k] == xi[k - 1])
00091                         return mkString(_("slot i is not *strictly* increasing inside a column (even after cholmod_l_sort)"));
00092             }
00093         } else { /* no modifying sorting : */
00094             return mkString(_("row indices are not sorted within columns"));
00095         }
00096     } else if(!strictly) {  /* sorted, but not strictly */
00097         return mkString(_("slot i is not *strictly* increasing inside a column"));
00098     }
00099     return ScalarLogical(1);
00100 }
00101 
00102 SEXP Rsparse_validate(SEXP x)
00103 {
00104     /* NB: we do *NOT* check a potential 'x' slot here, at all */
00105     SEXP pslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym),
00106         jslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_jSym);
00107     Rboolean sorted, strictly;
00108     int i, k,
00109         *dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym)),
00110         nrow = dims[0],
00111         ncol = dims[1],
00112         *xp = INTEGER(pslot),
00113         *xj = INTEGER(jslot);
00114 
00115     if (length(pslot) != dims[0] + 1)
00116         return mkString(_("slot p must have length = nrow(.) + 1"));
00117     if (xp[0] != 0)
00118         return mkString(_("first element of slot p must be zero"));
00119     if (length(jslot) < xp[nrow]) /* allow larger slots from over-allocation!*/
00120         return
00121             mkString(_("last element of slot p must match length of slots j and x"));
00122     for (i = 0; i < length(jslot); i++) {
00123         if (xj[i] < 0 || xj[i] >= ncol)
00124             return mkString(_("all column indices must be between 0 and ncol-1"));
00125     }
00126     sorted = TRUE; strictly = TRUE;
00127     for (i = 0; i < nrow; i++) {
00128         if (xp[i] > xp[i+1])
00129             return mkString(_("slot p must be non-decreasing"));
00130         if(sorted)
00131             for (k = xp[i] + 1; k < xp[i + 1]; k++) {
00132                 if (xj[k] < xj[k - 1])
00133                     sorted = FALSE;
00134                 else if (xj[k] == xj[k - 1])
00135                     strictly = FALSE;
00136             }
00137     }
00138     if (!sorted)
00139         /* cannot easily use cholmod_l_sort(.) ... -> "error out" :*/
00140         return mkString(_("slot j is not increasing inside a column"));
00141     else if(!strictly) /* sorted, but not strictly */
00142         return mkString(_("slot j is not *strictly* increasing inside a column"));
00143 
00144     return ScalarLogical(1);
00145 }

00149 /* Can only return [dln]geMatrix (no symm/triang);
00150  * FIXME: replace by non-CHOLMOD code ! */
00151 SEXP Csparse_to_dense(SEXP x)
00152 {
00153     CHM_SP chxs = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00154     /* This loses the symmetry property, since cholmod_dense has none,
00155      * BUT, much worse (FIXME!), it also transforms CHOLMOD_PATTERN ("n") matrices
00156      * to numeric (CHOLMOD_REAL) ones : */
00157     CHM_DN chxd = cholmod_l_sparse_to_dense(chxs, &c);
00158     int Rkind = (chxs->xtype == CHOLMOD_PATTERN)? -1 : Real_kind(x);
00159     R_CheckStack();
00160 
00161     return chm_dense_to_SEXP(chxd, 1, Rkind, GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00162 }

00164 // FIXME: do not go via CHM (should not be too hard, to just *drop* the x-slot, right?
00165 SEXP Csparse_to_nz_pattern(SEXP x, SEXP tri)
00166 {
00167     CHM_SP chxs = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00168     CHM_SP chxcp = cholmod_l_copy(chxs, chxs->stype, CHOLMOD_PATTERN, &c);
00169     int tr = asLogical(tri);
00170     R_CheckStack();
00171 
00172     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chxcp, 1/*do_free*/,
00173                               tr ? ((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1) : 0,
00174                               0, tr ? diag_P(x) : "",
00175                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00176 }

00178 // n.CMatrix --> [dli].CMatrix  (not going through CHM!)
00179 SEXP nz_pattern_to_Csparse(SEXP x, SEXP res_kind)
00180 {
00181     return nz2Csparse(x, asInteger(res_kind));
00182 }
00183 // n.CMatrix --> [dli].CMatrix  (not going through CHM!)
00184 SEXP nz2Csparse(SEXP x, enum x_slot_kind r_kind)
00185 {
00186     const char *cl_x = class_P(x);
00187     if(cl_x[0] != 'n') error(_("not a 'n.CMatrix'"));
00188     if(cl_x[2] != 'C') error(_("not a CsparseMatrix"));
00189     int nnz = LENGTH(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_iSym));
00190     SEXP ans;
00191     char *ncl = strdup(cl_x);
00192     double *dx_x; int *ix_x;
00193     ncl[0] = (r_kind == x_double ? 'd' :
00194               (r_kind == x_logical ? 'l' :
00195                /* else (for now):  r_kind == x_integer : */ 'i'));
00196     PROTECT(ans = NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS(ncl)));
00197     // create a correct 'x' slot:
00198     switch(r_kind) {
00199         int i;
00200     case x_double: // 'd'
00201         dx_x = REAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, REALSXP, nnz));
00202         for (i=0; i < nnz; i++) dx_x[i] = 1.;
00203         break;
00204     case x_logical: // 'l'
00205         ix_x = LOGICAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, LGLSXP, nnz));
00206         for (i=0; i < nnz; i++) ix_x[i] = TRUE;
00207         break;
00208     case x_integer: // 'i'
00209         ix_x = INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, INTSXP, nnz));
00210         for (i=0; i < nnz; i++) ix_x[i] = 1;
00211         break;
00212 
00213     default:
00214         error(_("nz2Csparse(): invalid/non-implemented r_kind = %d"),
00215               r_kind);
00216     }
00217 
00218     // now copy all other slots :
00219     slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_iSym);
00220     slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_pSym);
00221     slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_DimSym);
00222     slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_DimNamesSym);
00223     if(ncl[1] != 'g') { // symmetric or triangular ...
00224         slot_dup_if_has(ans, x, Matrix_uploSym);
00225         slot_dup_if_has(ans, x, Matrix_diagSym);
00226     }
00227     UNPROTECT(1);
00228     return ans;
00229 }

00234                                1 /*do_free*/, GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));

00237 SEXP Csparse_to_Tsparse(SEXP x, SEXP tri)
00238 {
00239     CHM_SP chxs = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00240     CHM_TR chxt = cholmod_l_sparse_to_triplet(chxs, &c);
00241     int tr = asLogical(tri);
00242     int Rkind = (chxs->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00243     R_CheckStack();
00244 
00245     return chm_triplet_to_SEXP(chxt, 1,
00246                                tr ? ((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1) : 0,
00247                                Rkind, tr ? diag_P(x) : "",
00248                                GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00249 }

00251 /* this used to be called  sCMatrix_to_gCMatrix(..)   [in ./dsCMatrix.c ]: */
00252 SEXP Csparse_symmetric_to_general(SEXP x)
00253 {
00254     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x), chgx;
00255     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00256     R_CheckStack();
00257 
00258     if (!(chx->stype))
00259         error(_("Nonsymmetric matrix in Csparse_symmetric_to_general"));
00260     chgx = cholmod_l_copy(chx, /* stype: */ 0, chx->xtype, &c);
00261     /* xtype: pattern, "real", complex or .. */
00262     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chgx, 1, 0, Rkind, "",
00263                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00264 }

00266 SEXP Csparse_general_to_symmetric(SEXP x, SEXP uplo)
00267 {
00268     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x), chgx;
00269     int uploT = (*CHAR(STRING_ELT(uplo,0)) == 'U') ? 1 : -1;
00270     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00271     R_CheckStack();
00272 
00273     chgx = cholmod_l_copy(chx, /* stype: */ uploT, chx->xtype, &c);
00274     /* xtype: pattern, "real", complex or .. */
00275     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chgx, 1, 0, Rkind, "",
00276                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00277 }

00279 SEXP Csparse_transpose(SEXP x, SEXP tri)
00280 {
00281     /* TODO: lgCMatrix & igC* currently go via double prec. cholmod -
00282      *       since cholmod (& cs) lacks sparse 'int' matrices */
00283     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00284     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00285     CHM_SP chxt = cholmod_l_transpose(chx, chx->xtype, &c);
00286     SEXP dn = PROTECT(duplicate(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym))), tmp;
00287     int tr = asLogical(tri);
00288     R_CheckStack();
00289 
00290     tmp = VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0);    /* swap the dimnames */
00291     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0, VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1));
00292     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1, tmp);
00293     UNPROTECT(1);
00294     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chxt, 1, /* SWAP 'uplo' for triangular */
00295                               tr ? ((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? -1 : 1) : 0,
00296                               Rkind, tr ? diag_P(x) : "", dn);
00297 }
00298 
00299 SEXP Csparse_Csparse_prod(SEXP a, SEXP b)
00300 {
00301     CHM_SP
00302         cha = AS_CHM_SP(a),
00303         chb = AS_CHM_SP(b),
00304         chc = cholmod_l_ssmult(cha, chb, /*out_stype:*/ 0,
00305                                /* values:= is_numeric (T/F) */ cha->xtype > 0,
00306                                /*out sorted:*/ 1, &c);
00307     const char *cl_a = class_P(a), *cl_b = class_P(b);
00308     char diag[] = {'\0', '\0'};
00309     int uploT = 0;
00310     SEXP dn = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2));
00311     R_CheckStack();
00312 
00313 #ifdef DEBUG_Matrix_verbose
00314     Rprintf("DBG Csparse_C*_prod(%s, %s)\n", cl_a, cl_b);
00315 #endif
00316 
00317     /* Preserve triangularity and even unit-triangularity if appropriate.
00318      * Note that in that case, the multiplication itself should happen
00319      * faster.  But there's no support for that in CHOLMOD */
00320 
00321     /* UGLY hack -- rather should have (fast!) C-level version of
00322      *       is(a, "triangularMatrix") etc */
00323     if (cl_a[1] == 't' && cl_b[1] == 't')
00324         /* FIXME: fails for "Cholesky","BunchKaufmann"..*/
00325         if(*uplo_P(a) == *uplo_P(b)) { /* both upper, or both lower tri. */
00326             uploT = (*uplo_P(a) == 'U') ? 1 : -1;
00327             if(*diag_P(a) == 'U' && *diag_P(b) == 'U') { /* return UNIT-triag. */
00328                 /* "remove the diagonal entries": */
00329                 chm_diagN2U(chc, uploT, /* do_realloc */ FALSE);
00330                 diag[0]= 'U';
00331             }
00332             else diag[0]= 'N';
00333         }
00334     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00335                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 0)));
00336     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1,
00337                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(b, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 1)));
00338     UNPROTECT(1);
00339     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chc, 1, uploT, /*Rkind*/0, diag, dn);
00340 }
00341 
00342 SEXP Csparse_Csparse_crossprod(SEXP a, SEXP b, SEXP trans)
00343 {
00344     int tr = asLogical(trans);
00345     CHM_SP
00346         cha = AS_CHM_SP(a),
00347         chb = AS_CHM_SP(b),
00348         chTr, chc;
00349     const char *cl_a = class_P(a), *cl_b = class_P(b);
00350     char diag[] = {'\0', '\0'};
00351     int uploT = 0;
00352     SEXP dn = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2));
00353     R_CheckStack();
00354 
00355     chTr = cholmod_l_transpose((tr) ? chb : cha, chb->xtype, &c);
00356     chc = cholmod_l_ssmult((tr) ? cha : chTr, (tr) ? chTr : chb,
00357                          /*out_stype:*/ 0, cha->xtype, /*out sorted:*/ 1, &c);
00358     cholmod_l_free_sparse(&chTr, &c);
00359 
00360     /* Preserve triangularity and unit-triangularity if appropriate;
00361      * see Csparse_Csparse_prod() for comments */
00362     if (cl_a[1] == 't' && cl_b[1] == 't')
00363         if(*uplo_P(a) != *uplo_P(b)) { /* one 'U', the other 'L' */
00364             uploT = (*uplo_P(b) == 'U') ? 1 : -1;
00365             if(*diag_P(a) == 'U' && *diag_P(b) == 'U') { /* return UNIT-triag. */
00366                 chm_diagN2U(chc, uploT, /* do_realloc */ FALSE);
00367                 diag[0]= 'U';
00368             }
00369             else diag[0]= 'N';
00370         }
00371     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00372                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimNamesSym), (tr) ? 0 : 1)));
00373     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1,
00374                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(b, Matrix_DimNamesSym), (tr) ? 0 : 1)));
00375     UNPROTECT(1);
00376     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chc, 1, uploT, /*Rkind*/0, diag, dn);
00377 }
00378 
00379 SEXP Csparse_dense_prod(SEXP a, SEXP b)
00380 {
00381     CHM_SP cha = AS_CHM_SP(a);
00382     SEXP b_M = PROTECT(mMatrix_as_dgeMatrix(b));
00383     CHM_DN chb = AS_CHM_DN(b_M);
00384     CHM_DN chc = cholmod_l_allocate_dense(cha->nrow, chb->ncol, cha->nrow,
00385                                         chb->xtype, &c);
00386     SEXP dn = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2));
00387     double one[] = {1,0}, zero[] = {0,0};
00388     int nprot = 2;
00389     R_CheckStack();
00390     /* Tim Davis, please FIXME:  currently (2010-11) *fails* when  a  is a pattern matrix:*/
00391     if(cha->xtype == CHOLMOD_PATTERN) {
00392         /* warning(_("Csparse_dense_prod(): cholmod_sdmult() not yet implemented for pattern./ ngCMatrix" */
00393         /*        " --> slightly inefficient coercion")); */
00394 
00395         // This *fails* to produce a CHOLMOD_REAL ..
00396         // CHM_SP chd = cholmod_l_copy(cha, cha->stype, CHOLMOD_REAL, &c);
00397         // --> use our Matrix-classes
00398         SEXP da = PROTECT(nz2Csparse(a, x_double)); nprot++;
00399         cha = AS_CHM_SP(da);
00400     }
00401     cholmod_l_sdmult(cha, 0, one, zero, chb, chc, &c);
00402     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00403                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 0)));
00404     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1,
00405                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(b_M, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 1)));
00406     UNPROTECT(nprot);
00407     return chm_dense_to_SEXP(chc, 1, 0, dn);
00408 }
00409 
00410 SEXP Csparse_dense_crossprod(SEXP a, SEXP b)
00411 {
00412     CHM_SP cha = AS_CHM_SP(a);
00413     SEXP b_M = PROTECT(mMatrix_as_dgeMatrix(b));
00414     CHM_DN chb = AS_CHM_DN(b_M);
00415     CHM_DN chc = cholmod_l_allocate_dense(cha->ncol, chb->ncol, cha->ncol,
00416                                         chb->xtype, &c);
00417     SEXP dn = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2)); int nprot = 2;
00418     double one[] = {1,0}, zero[] = {0,0};
00419     R_CheckStack();
00420     // -- see Csparse_dense_prod() above :
00421     if(cha->xtype == CHOLMOD_PATTERN) {
00422         SEXP da = PROTECT(nz2Csparse(a, x_double)); nprot++;
00423         cha = AS_CHM_SP(da);
00424     }
00425     cholmod_l_sdmult(cha, 1, one, zero, chb, chc, &c);
00426     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00427                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 1)));
00428     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1,
00429                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(b_M, Matrix_DimNamesSym), 1)));
00430     UNPROTECT(nprot);
00431     return chm_dense_to_SEXP(chc, 1, 0, dn);
00432 }
00433 
00434 /* Computes   x'x  or  x x' -- *also* for Tsparse (triplet = TRUE)
00435    see Csparse_Csparse_crossprod above for  x'y and x y' */
00436 SEXP Csparse_crossprod(SEXP x, SEXP trans, SEXP triplet)
00437 {
00438     int trip = asLogical(triplet),
00439         tr   = asLogical(trans); /* gets reversed because _aat is tcrossprod */
00440 #ifdef AS_CHM_DIAGU2N_FIXED_FINALLY
00441     CHM_TR cht = trip ? AS_CHM_TR(x) : (CHM_TR) NULL;
00442 #else /* workaround needed:*/
00443     SEXP xx = PROTECT(Tsparse_diagU2N(x));
00444     CHM_TR cht = trip ? AS_CHM_TR__(xx) : (CHM_TR) NULL;
00445 #endif
00446     CHM_SP chcp, chxt,
00447         chx = (trip ?
00448                cholmod_l_triplet_to_sparse(cht, cht->nnz, &c) :
00449                AS_CHM_SP(x));
00450     SEXP dn = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2));
00451     R_CheckStack();
00452 
00453     if (!tr) chxt = cholmod_l_transpose(chx, chx->xtype, &c);
00454     chcp = cholmod_l_aat((!tr) ? chxt : chx, (int *) NULL, 0, chx->xtype, &c);
00455     if(!chcp) {
00456         UNPROTECT(1);
00457         error(_("Csparse_crossprod(): error return from cholmod_l_aat()"));
00458     }
00459     cholmod_l_band_inplace(0, chcp->ncol, chcp->xtype, chcp, &c);
00460     chcp->stype = 1;
00461     if (trip) cholmod_l_free_sparse(&chx, &c);
00462     if (!tr) cholmod_l_free_sparse(&chxt, &c);
00463     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0,       /* establish dimnames */
00464                    duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym),
00465                                         (tr) ? 0 : 1)));
00466     SET_VECTOR_ELT(dn, 1, duplicate(VECTOR_ELT(dn, 0)));
00467 #ifdef AS_CHM_DIAGU2N_FIXED_FINALLY
00468     UNPROTECT(1);
00469 #else
00470     UNPROTECT(2);
00471 #endif
00472     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chcp, 1, 0, 0, "", dn);
00473 }
00474 
00475 SEXP Csparse_drop(SEXP x, SEXP tol)
00476 {
00477     const char *cl = class_P(x);
00478     /* dtCMatrix, etc; [1] = the second character =?= 't' for triangular */
00479     int tr = (cl[1] == 't');
00480     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00481     CHM_SP ans = cholmod_l_copy(chx, chx->stype, chx->xtype, &c);
00482     double dtol = asReal(tol);
00483     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00484     R_CheckStack();
00485 
00486     if(!cholmod_l_drop(dtol, ans, &c))
00487         error(_("cholmod_l_drop() failed"));
00488     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(ans, 1,
00489                               tr ? ((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1) : 0,
00490                               Rkind, tr ? diag_P(x) : "",
00491                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00492 }
00493 
00494 SEXP Csparse_horzcat(SEXP x, SEXP y)
00495 {
00496     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x), chy = AS_CHM_SP__(y);
00497     int Rk_x = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0,
00498         Rk_y = (chy->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(y) : 0,
00499         Rkind = /* logical if both x and y are */ (Rk_x == 1 && Rk_y == 1) ? 1 : 0;
00500     R_CheckStack();
00501 
00502     /* TODO: currently drops dimnames - and we fix at R level */
00503     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(cholmod_l_horzcat(chx, chy, 1, &c),
00504                               1, 0, Rkind, "", R_NilValue);
00505 }
00506 
00507 SEXP Csparse_vertcat(SEXP x, SEXP y)
00508 {
00509     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x), chy = AS_CHM_SP__(y);
00510     int Rk_x = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0,
00511         Rk_y = (chy->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(y) : 0,
00512         Rkind = /* logical if both x and y are */ (Rk_x == 1 && Rk_y == 1) ? 1 : 0;
00513     R_CheckStack();
00514 
00515     /* TODO: currently drops dimnames - and we fix at R level */
00516     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(cholmod_l_vertcat(chx, chy, 1, &c),
00517                               1, 0, Rkind, "", R_NilValue);
00518 }
00519 
00520 SEXP Csparse_band(SEXP x, SEXP k1, SEXP k2)
00521 {
00522     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00523     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00524     CHM_SP ans = cholmod_l_band(chx, asInteger(k1), asInteger(k2), chx->xtype, &c);
00525     R_CheckStack();
00526 
00527     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(ans, 1, 0, Rkind, "",
00528                               GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00529 }
00530 
00531 SEXP Csparse_diagU2N(SEXP x)
00532 {
00533     const char *cl = class_P(x);
00534     /* dtCMatrix, etc; [1] = the second character =?= 't' for triangular */
00535     if (cl[1] != 't' || *diag_P(x) != 'U') {
00536         /* "trivially fast" when not triangular (<==> no 'diag' slot),
00537            or not *unit* triangular */
00538         return (x);
00539     }
00540     else { /* unit triangular (diag='U'): "fill the diagonal" & diag:= "N" */
00541         CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(x);
00542         CHM_SP eye = cholmod_l_speye(chx->nrow, chx->ncol, chx->xtype, &c);
00543         double one[] = {1, 0};
00544         CHM_SP ans = cholmod_l_add(chx, eye, one, one, TRUE, TRUE, &c);
00545         int uploT = (*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1;
00546         int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00547 
00548         R_CheckStack();
00549         cholmod_l_free_sparse(&eye, &c);
00550         return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(ans, 1, uploT, Rkind, "N",
00551                                   GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00552     }
00553 }
00554 
00555 SEXP Csparse_diagN2U(SEXP x)
00556 {
00557     const char *cl = class_P(x);
00558     /* dtCMatrix, etc; [1] = the second character =?= 't' for triangular */
00559     if (cl[1] != 't' || *diag_P(x) != 'N') {
00560         /* "trivially fast" when not triangular (<==> no 'diag' slot),
00561            or already *unit* triangular */
00562         return (x);
00563     }
00564     else { /* triangular with diag='N'): now drop the diagonal */
00565         /* duplicate, since chx will be modified: */
00566         CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP__(duplicate(x));
00567         int uploT = (*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? 1 : -1,
00568             Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00569         R_CheckStack();
00570 
00571         chm_diagN2U(chx, uploT, /* do_realloc */ FALSE);
00572 
00573         return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(chx, /*dofree*/ 0/* or 1 ?? */,
00574                                   uploT, Rkind, "U",
00575                                   GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimNamesSym));
00576     }
00577 }
00578 
00588 SEXP Csparse_submatrix(SEXP x, SEXP i, SEXP j)
00589 {
00590     CHM_SP chx = AS_CHM_SP(x); /* << does diagU2N() when needed */
00591     int rsize = (isNull(i)) ? -1 : LENGTH(i),
00592         csize = (isNull(j)) ? -1 : LENGTH(j);
00593     int Rkind = (chx->xtype != CHOLMOD_PATTERN) ? Real_kind(x) : 0;
00594     R_CheckStack();
00595 
00596     if (rsize >= 0 && !isInteger(i))
00597         error(_("Index i must be NULL or integer"));
00598     if (csize >= 0 && !isInteger(j))
00599         error(_("Index j must be NULL or integer"));
00600 
00601     if (chx->stype) /* symmetricMatrix */
00602         /* for now, cholmod_submatrix() only accepts "generalMatrix" */
00603         chx = cholmod_l_copy(chx, /* stype: */ 0, chx->xtype, &c);
00604 
00605     return chm_sparse_to_SEXP(cholmod_l_submatrix(chx,
00606                                 (rsize < 0) ? NULL : INTEGER(i), rsize,
00607                                 (csize < 0) ? NULL : INTEGER(j), csize,
00608                                                   TRUE, TRUE, &c),
00609                               1, 0, Rkind, "",
00610                               /* FIXME: drops dimnames */ R_NilValue);
00611 }
00612 
00613 SEXP Csparse_MatrixMarket(SEXP x, SEXP fname)
00614 {
00615     FILE *f = fopen(CHAR(asChar(fname)), "w");
00616 
00617     if (!f)
00618         error(_("failure to open file \"%s\" for writing"),
00619               CHAR(asChar(fname)));
00620     if (!cholmod_l_write_sparse(f, AS_CHM_SP(x),
00621                               (CHM_SP)NULL, (char*) NULL, &c))
00622         error(_("cholmod_l_write_sparse returned error code"));
00623     fclose(f);
00624     return R_NilValue;
00625 }
00626 
00627 
00640 SEXP diag_tC_ptr(int n, int *x_p, double *x_x, int *perm, SEXP resultKind)
00641 /*                                ^^^^^^ FIXME[Generalize] to int / ... */
00642 {
00643     const char* res_ch = CHAR(STRING_ELT(resultKind,0));
00644     enum diag_kind { diag, diag_backpermuted, trace, prod, sum_log
00645     } res_kind = ((!strcmp(res_ch, "trace")) ? trace :
00646                   ((!strcmp(res_ch, "sumLog")) ? sum_log :
00647                    ((!strcmp(res_ch, "prod")) ? prod :
00648                     ((!strcmp(res_ch, "diag")) ? diag :
00649                      ((!strcmp(res_ch, "diagBack")) ? diag_backpermuted :
00650                       -1)))));
00651     int i, n_x, i_from = 0;
00652     SEXP ans = PROTECT(allocVector(REALSXP,
00653 /*                                 ^^^^  FIXME[Generalize] */
00654                                    (res_kind == diag ||
00655                                     res_kind == diag_backpermuted) ? n : 1));
00656     double *v = REAL(ans);
00657 /*  ^^^^^^      ^^^^  FIXME[Generalize] */
00658 
00659 #define for_DIAG(v_ASSIGN)                                              \
00660     for(i = 0; i < n; i++, i_from += n_x) {                             \
00661         /* looking at i-th column */                                    \
00662         n_x = x_p[i+1] - x_p[i];/* #{entries} in this column */ \
00663         v_ASSIGN;                                                       \
00664     }
00665 
00666     /* NOTA BENE: we assume  -- uplo = "L" i.e. lower triangular matrix
00667      *            for uplo = "U" (makes sense with a "dtCMatrix" !),
00668      *            should use  x_x[i_from + (nx - 1)] instead of x_x[i_from],
00669      *            where nx = (x_p[i+1] - x_p[i])
00670      */
00671 
00672     switch(res_kind) {
00673     case trace:
00674         v[0] = 0.;
00675         for_DIAG(v[0] += x_x[i_from]);
00676         break;
00677 
00678     case sum_log:
00679         v[0] = 0.;
00680         for_DIAG(v[0] += log(x_x[i_from]));
00681         break;
00682 
00683     case prod:
00684         v[0] = 1.;
00685         for_DIAG(v[0] *= x_x[i_from]);
00686         break;
00687 
00688     case diag:
00689         for_DIAG(v[i] = x_x[i_from]);
00690         break;
00691 
00692     case diag_backpermuted:
00693         for_DIAG(v[i] = x_x[i_from]);
00694 
00695         warning(_("resultKind = 'diagBack' (back-permuted) is experimental"));
00696         /* now back_permute : */
00697         for(i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00698             double tmp = v[i]; v[i] = v[perm[i]]; v[perm[i]] = tmp;
00699             /*^^^^ FIXME[Generalize] */
00700         }
00701         break;
00702 
00703     default: /* -1 from above */
00704         error(_("diag_tC(): invalid 'resultKind'"));
00705         /* Wall: */ ans = R_NilValue; v = REAL(ans);
00706     }
00707 
00708     UNPROTECT(1);
00709     return ans;
00710 }
00711 
00724 SEXP diag_tC(SEXP pslot, SEXP xslot, SEXP perm_slot, SEXP resultKind)
00725 {
00726     int n = length(pslot) - 1, /* n = ncol(.) = nrow(.) */
00727         *x_p  = INTEGER(pslot),
00728         *perm = INTEGER(perm_slot);
00729     double *x_x = REAL(xslot);
00730 /*  ^^^^^^        ^^^^ FIXME[Generalize] to INTEGER(.) / LOGICAL(.) / ... xslot !*/
00731 
00732     return diag_tC_ptr(n, x_p, x_x, perm, resultKind);
00733 }
00734 
00753 SEXP create_Csparse(char* cls, int* i, int* j, int* p, int np,
00754                     void* x, int nnz, int* dims, SEXP dimnames,
00755                     int index1)
00756 {
00757     SEXP ans;
00758     int *ij = (int*)NULL, *tri, *trj,
00759         mi, mj, mp, nrow = -1, ncol = -1;
00760     int xtype = -1;             /* -Wall */
00761     CHM_TR T;
00762     CHM_SP A;
00763 
00764     if (np < 0 || nnz < 0)
00765         error(_("negative vector lengths not allowed: np = %d, nnz = %d"),
00766               np, nnz);
00767     if (1 != ((mi = (i == (int*)NULL)) +
00768               (mj = (j == (int*)NULL)) +
00769               (mp = (p == (int*)NULL))))
00770         error(_("exactly 1 of 'i', 'j' or 'p' must be NULL"));
00771     if (mp) {
00772         if (np) error(_("np = %d, must be zero when p is NULL"), np);
00773     } else {
00774         if (np) {               /* Expand p to form i or j */
00775             if (!(p[0])) error(_("p[0] = %d, should be zero"), p[0]);
00776             for (int ii = 0; ii < np; ii++)
00777                 if (p[ii] > p[ii + 1])
00778                     error(_("p must be non-decreasing"));
00779             if (p[np] != nnz)
00780                 error("p[np] = %d != nnz = %d", p[np], nnz);
00781             ij = Calloc(nnz, int);
00782             if (mi) {
00783                 i = ij;
00784                 nrow = np;
00785             } else {
00786                 j = ij;
00787                 ncol = np;
00788             }
00789                                 /* Expand p to 0-based indices */
00790             for (int ii = 0; ii < np; ii++)
00791                 for (int jj = p[ii]; jj < p[ii + 1]; jj++) ij[jj] = ii;
00792         } else {
00793             if (nnz)
00794                 error(_("Inconsistent dimensions: np = 0 and nnz = %d"),
00795                       nnz);
00796         }
00797     }
00798                                 /* calculate nrow and ncol */
00799     if (nrow < 0) {
00800         for (int ii = 0; ii < nnz; ii++) {
00801             int i1 = i[ii] + (index1 ? 0 : 1); /* 1-based index */
00802             if (i1 < 1) error(_("invalid row index at position %d"), ii);
00803             if (i1 > nrow) nrow = i1;
00804         }
00805     }
00806     if (ncol < 0) {
00807         for (int jj = 0; jj < nnz; jj++) {
00808             int j1 = j[jj] + (index1 ? 0 : 1);
00809             if (j1 < 1) error(_("invalid column index at position %d"), jj);
00810             if (j1 > ncol) ncol = j1;
00811         }
00812     }
00813     if (dims != (int*)NULL) {
00814         if (dims[0] > nrow) nrow = dims[0];
00815         if (dims[1] > ncol) ncol = dims[1];
00816     }
00817                                 /* check the class name */
00818     if (strlen(cls) != 8)
00819         error(_("strlen of cls argument = %d, should be 8"), strlen(cls));
00820     if (!strcmp(cls + 2, "CMatrix"))
00821         error(_("cls = \"%s\" does not end in \"CMatrix\""), cls);
00822     switch(cls[0]) {
00823     case 'd':
00824     case 'l':
00825            xtype = CHOLMOD_REAL;
00826            break;
00827     case 'n':
00828            xtype = CHOLMOD_PATTERN;
00829            break;
00830     default:
00831            error(_("cls = \"%s\" must begin with 'd', 'l' or 'n'"), cls);
00832     }
00833     if (cls[1] != 'g')
00834         error(_("Only 'g'eneral sparse matrix types allowed"));
00835                                 /* allocate and populate the triplet */
00836     T = cholmod_l_allocate_triplet((size_t)nrow, (size_t)ncol, (size_t)nnz, 0,
00837                                     xtype, &c);
00838     T->x = x;
00839     tri = (int*)T->i;
00840     trj = (int*)T->j;
00841     for (int ii = 0; ii < nnz; ii++) {
00842         tri[ii] = i[ii] - ((!mi && index1) ? 1 : 0);
00843         trj[ii] = j[ii] - ((!mj && index1) ? 1 : 0);
00844     }
00845                                 /* create the cholmod_sparse structure */
00846     A = cholmod_l_triplet_to_sparse(T, nnz, &c);
00847     cholmod_l_free_triplet(&T, &c);
00848                                 /* copy the information to the SEXP */
00849     ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS(cls)));
00850 /* FIXME: This has been copied from chm_sparse_to_SEXP in chm_common.c */
00851                                 /* allocate and copy common slots */
00852     nnz = cholmod_l_nnz(A, &c);
00853     dims = INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, INTSXP, 2));
00854     dims[0] = A->nrow; dims[1] = A->ncol;
00855     Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_pSym, INTSXP, A->ncol + 1)), (int*)A->p, A->ncol + 1);
00856     Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_iSym, INTSXP, nnz)), (int*)A->i, nnz);
00857     switch(cls[1]) {
00858     case 'd':
00859         Memcpy(REAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, REALSXP, nnz)), (double*)A->x, nnz);
00860         break;
00861     case 'l':
00862         error(_("code not yet written for cls = \"lgCMatrix\""));
00863     }
00864     cholmod_l_free_sparse(&A, &c);
00865     UNPROTECT(1);
00866     return ans;
00867 }
Generated on Sat Dec 11 2010 19:50:59 for Matrix by  1.7.1
